cards.kikuyu: Around your sitting room.** | Kikuyu Word | English Word | | :--- | :--- | | **Mũrango** | Door | | **Kabati** | Cupboard | | **Metha** | Table | | **Nđirica** | Window | | **Gĩtĩ** | Chair | | **Gaturwa / Njĩngwa** | Stool | --- ## Text from Image 2: Gĩkũyũ na Mũũmbi (Kikuyu Creation Story) **Gĩkũyũ na Mũũmbi** **Aciari a rũrĩrĩ rwa Gĩkũyũ nĩ a ?** Who are the parents of the kikuyu tribe? **Aciari a rũrĩrĩ rwa Gĩkũyũ nĩ Gĩkũyũ na Mũũmbi** The parents of the Kikuyu are Gĩkũyũ and Mũũmbi **Maarĩ na ciana cigana?** How many children did they have? **Marĩ na ciana kenda** They had nine children. **Kenda mũiyũrũ** - the full nine (ten) **Tũhĩĩ kana tũirĩtu?** Girls or boys? **Tũirĩtu** - Girls. | Kikuyu Word | English Meaning | | :--- | :--- | | **Rũrĩrĩ** | a community speaking one language | | **Nyũmba** | house (traditionally woman's hut) | | **Thingira** | hut (traditionally for men) | | **Ikũmbĩ** | granary | | **Mũgũnda** | garden, farm. **Gĩcagi** - a village | --- ## Text from Image 3: Jobs **Jobs** **(Nĩĩ) Nđĩ bundi** - I am a handyman (carpenter, plumber etc.) **Nđutaga wĩra wa mbaũ** - I work with timber **. (Wee) wĩ mũrĩmi** - You are a farmer **Ũrutaga wĩra wa mũgũnda** - You work in a farm **. (We) nĩ ndereba** - he/she is a driver **. (Inyuĩ) mwĩ atongoria** - You (plural) are leaders **Mũrutaga wĩra wa gũtongoria anđũ** - your job is to lead people **. (O) nĩ borithi** - they are police (men/women) **Marutaga wĩra wa kũũnĩtĩa anđũ** - their work is to arrest people **. Ũyũ nĩ mũũbĩa** - this is a priest (catholic) **Arutaga wĩra wa gũtongoria magongona ma kanitha** - His work is to lead church services 1. **(Nĩĩ) Nđĩ mũhũrĩri wa mbica** - I am a photographer 2. **(Wee) wĩ mũgwĩmi** - You are a hunter 3. **(We) nĩ mũrĩithia wa mahiũ** - he/she is a herder (of domestic animals) 4. **(Inyũĩ) mwĩ aturi** - You are iron mongers 5. **(O) nĩ ombi a nyũngũ** - they are potters (lit. molders of pots) 6. **Ũyũ nĩ mũgo** - This is a medicine (person) **Write sentences in Kikuyu to say what Numbes 1. to 6. do. cards.kikuyu: You've uploaded several images containing Kikuyu language lessons, covering vocabulary, grammar, and sentence structure. Here is a compilation and synthesis of the information presented in those images. *** ## 1. Grammar: Future Tenses (Second Person Singular) The images illustrate the **Second Person Singular** (you) future tense, which has different prefixes depending on the time frame. ### ⏳ A Few Moments Later or Anytime Today The prefixes used for actions happening soon are **Ûgû-, Ûgwî-, Ûkwî-,** and **Ûkû-**. | Example | Translation | Prefix | | :--- | :--- | :--- | | **Ûgûkîra** dagîka ikûmi ciathira. | You will wake up after ten minutes. | Ûgû- | | **Ûgwîthamba** na maî mahoro. | You will take a bath with cold water. | Ûgwî- | | **Ûkwîhumba** nguo naihenya. | You will put on your clothes quickly. | Ûkwî- | ### 🗓️ Anytime Tomorrow and Into the Future The prefixes used for actions happening tomorrow or beyond are **Ûgo-, Ûge-, Ûke-,** and **Ûga-**. | Example | Translation | Prefix | | :--- | :--- | :--- | | **Ûgokîra** dagîka ikûmi ciathira. | You will wake up ten after ten minutes. | Ûgo- | | **Ûgethamba** na maî mahoro. | You will take a bath with cold water. | Ûge- | | **Ûkehumba** nguo naihenya. | You will put on your clothes quickly. | Ûke- | | **Ûkaruga** caî. | You will make tea. | Ûka- | *** ## 2. Vocabulary: Types of Houses (*Mîthemba ya Nyûmba*) The lessons cover three main types of traditional and modern houses, focusing on construction materials. | Type of House | Kikuyu Term | Construction Material | Roofing Material | Other Feature | | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | | **Stone House** | **Nyûmba ya Mahiga** | **Mahiga** (stones) | **Mabati** (iron sheets) | **Rûthingo rwa mahiga** (stone wall) | | **Timber House** | **Nyûmba ya mbaû** | **Mbaû** (timber/wood) | **Maturubarĩ** (tiles) | **Rûthingo rwa mbaû** (wooden wall) | | **Mud Hut** | **Nyûmba ya ndooro** | **Ndooro** (mud) | **Nyeki** (grass) or **ithanjĩ** (reeds) | **Rûthingo rwa ndooro** (mud wall) | *** ## 3. Vocabulary: Fauna and Weather ### 🐾 Insects (*Tûnyamû tûnyinyi*) | Kikuyu | English | Notes | | :--- | :--- | :--- | | **Mûthûa** | Termite | | | **Thûraku** | Soldier ant | Moves in a line. | | **Thigiriri** | Black ant | Small black ants. | | **Mûgagaca** | Fire ant | Very tiny brown ants that move in large groups. | ### 🐦 Birds (*Nyoni*) | Kikuyu | Scientific Name | English Name | | :--- | :--- | :--- | | **Kanyua njui** | *Cinnyris mediocris* | Sunbird | | **Gĩchorogothu** | *Pycnonotus barbatus* | Common bulbul | | **Ngũgũ** | *Tauraco hartlaubi* | Hartlaub's Turaco | ### ⛈️ Weather and Seasons (*Hîndî ya Mbura na ya riua*) | Kikuyu | English | Notes | | :--- | :--- | :--- | | **Rûheni** | Lightening | Comes before **marurumĩ** (thunder). | | **Mbura nî ya ringa** | The rain has started | Literally: 'the rain has beaten'. | | **Nî kûrathuthua** | It is drizzling | | | **Ime** | Dew | | | **Matu ma mbura** | Rain clouds | The grey ones. | | **Rûkûngû** | Dust | | | **Kigûû** | Flash flood | This word means *water* in Kikamba. | | **Thano** | Very dry season | | | **Mûkûnga mbura** | Rainbow | | | **Kwîna kibii** | There is fog | | *** ## 4. cards.kikuyu: Extracted Text from Images Here is the text extracted from the images you provided: --- ### Image 1: Kikuyu Creation Story (Gĩkũyũ na Mũũmbi) **Gĩkũyũ na Mũũmbi** **Aciari a rũrĩrĩ rwa Gĩkũyũ nĩ a ?** Who are the parents of the kikuyu tribe? **Aciari a rũrĩrĩ rwa Gĩkũyũ nĩ Gĩkũyũ na Mũũmbi** The parents of the Kikuyu are Gĩkũyũ and Mũũmbi **Maarĩ na ciana cigana?** How many children did they have? **Marĩ na ciana kenda** They had nine children. **Kenda mũiyũrũ** - the full nine (ten) **Tũhĩĩ kana tũirĩtu?** Girls or boys? **Tũirĩtu** - Girls. **Rũrĩrĩ** - a community speaking one language **Nyũmba** - house (traditionally woman's hut) **Thingira** - hut (traditionally for men) **Ikũmbĩ** - granary **Mũgũnda** - garden, farm. **Gĩcagi** - a village --- ### Image 2: Jobs (Wĩra) **Jobs** **(Nĩĩ) Nđĩ bundi** - I am a handyman (carpenter, plumber etc.) **Nđutaga wĩra wa mbaũ** - I work with timber **. (Wee) wĩ mũrĩmi** - You are a farmer **Ũrutaga wĩra wa mũgũnda** - You work in a farm **. (We) nĩ ndereba** - he/she is a driver **. (Inyuĩ) mwĩ atongoria** - You (plural) are leaders **Mũrutaga wĩra wa gũtongoria anđũ** - your job is to lead people **. (O) nĩ borithi** - they are police (men/women) **Marutaga wĩra wa kũũnĩtĩa anđũ** - their work is to arrest people **. Ũyũ nĩ mũũbĩa** - this is a priest (catholic) **Arutaga wĩra wa gũtongoria magongona ma kanitha** - His work is to lead church services 1. **(Nĩĩ) Nđĩ mũhũrĩri wa mbica** - I am a photographer 2. **(Wee) wĩ mũgwĩmi** - You are a hunter 3. **(We) nĩ mũrĩithia wa mahiũ** - he/she is a herder (of domestic animals) 4. **(Inyũĩ) mwĩ aturi** - You are iron mongers 5. **(O) nĩ ombi a nyũngũ** - they are potters (lit. molders of pots) 6. **Ũyũ nĩ mũgo** - This is a medicine (person) **Write sentences in Kikuyu to say what Numbes 1. to 6. do. Use the following verbs - 1. Kũhũra mbica, 2. kũgwĩma, 3. Kũrĩithia, 4. gũtura, 5. kũũmba, 6. kũragũra (Example: arutaga wĩra wa kũragũra)** --- ### Image 3: Polite Term for Snake **Nyamũ ya thĩ** - a polite way of refering to a **snake** (to avoid attracting it to your house). --- ### Image 4: Counting and Birds **Mbata** - Duck **Ngũkũ ya mwera** - Hen **Gacui** - chick **Ngũkũ ya njamba** - Cock --- ### Image 5: Some Verbs **Some Verbs that you should know** **Gũcaria** - to search **Gũcoka** - to return, to come back (person) **Gũcokia** - to return (an object) **Gũĩka** - To do **Gũikara** - to stay **Gũikara thĩ** - to sit down **Gũikena** - To be happy **Gũkinya** - To arrive, to step on **Gũthambia** - to wash **Gũthĩĩ rũgendo** - To go on a journey **Gũthũkia** - To damage, to spoil **Gũtigara** - to remain **Gũtinia** - to cut **Gweterera** - To wait **Gwĩcĩrĩria** - to think, to reason **Kũgeria** - to try --- ### Image 6: Family Terms (Nuclear and Extended) **Nuclear family** **Baba** - father **Maitũ** - Mother **Mũrũ wa maitũ** - Brother **Mwarĩ wa maitũ** - Sister **Mũrũ wa baba** - Half Brother **Mwarĩ wa baba** - Half Sister **Extended family** **Guka** - Grandfather (Muranga/Kiambu Kikuyu) **Wagũi** - Grandfather (Nyeri Kikuyu) **Cũcũ** - Grandmother **Tata** - Aunt **Mama** - Uncle (Mother's side) **Baba mũnini** - Uncle (Father's younger brother) **Baba mũkũrũ** - Uncle (Father's older brother) **Mũrũ wa tata** - Cousin **Mũrũ wa mama** - Cousin **NOTE**: All your Father's brothers' wives are adressed as "**mother**" **Thooma na ũnyite mũgambo** - read and record --- ### Image 7: Conversation about Family **Nuclear Family** **Ũyũ nĩ baba** - this is father **Ũyũ ũngĩ nĩ maitũ** - this other one is mother **Tũrũgamĩte na mwarĩ wa maitũ** - We are standing with my sister **Ũcio mũraihu nĩ mama** - the tall one is my uncle (mother's side) **Baba arahũra mbica** - Father is taking photographs **Mwarimũ:** Maina rũgama Maina, stand up **Maina:** Nĩ nđarũgama Mwarimũ **Mwarimũ:** Ũyũ nũũ ? cards.kikuyu: Here is the transcription of the Kikuyu vocabulary and example sentences about jobs from the image: ## Juma - Saturday: Mawira - Jobs | Kikuyu Sentence/Phrase | English Translation | Notes | | :--- | :--- | :--- | | **(Nĩĩ) Ndĩ injinia** | I am an engineer | | | **(Nĩĩ) Ndĩ mũhũrĩ wa mbica** | I am a photographer | **Mũhũrĩ** means striker/hitter, **mbica** means pictures. | | **(Wẽẽ) wĩ mũgwĩmi** | You are a hunter | | | **(Wẽ) nĩ mũrĩĩthia wa mahiũ** | he/she is a herder (of domestic animals) | | | **Mahiũ** | domestic animals | | | **(Inyuĩ) mwĩ aturi** | You are iron mongers | | | **(O) nĩ ombi a nyũngũ** | they are potters | *(*lit. molders of pots*)* | | **Ũyũ nĩ mugo** | This is a medicine (person) | **Mugo** traditionally refers to a medicine man or traditional healer. | *** A concluding note from the image: *The words in brackets can be ignored without change in meaning* (referring to the optional subject pronouns like **Nĩĩ**, **Wẽẽ**, etc.). cards.kikuyu: Rĩmai gũkumia - May you get the fruits of your labour Rĩmai - work on your farms gũkumia - where you will get results (fruits) This phrase is used as a blessing to anyone regardless of the profession, whether in business or employment. Kikuyus were traditionally farmers, hence the origin of the phrase.

cards.kikuyu: The image provides a list of Kikuyu words that end in **-go** and their English translations. Here is the breakdown of the list: | Kikuyu Word | English Translation | | :--- | :--- | | **Gĩcĩgo** | area | | **Igego** | tooth | | **Iyego** | a village in Murang'a | | **Kĩugo** | word | | **Mbogo** | buffalo | | **Mũgogo** | log | | **Mũndũ mũgo** | diviner / traditional healer | | **Mũrĩgo** | luggage | | **Mũtego** | trap | | **Mũtũgo** | habit | | **Ndoogo** | smoke | ### Additional Words/Names (Unformatted List on the Right) The right side of the image appears to be a list of user submissions or additional words, but some are incomplete or repeated: * **Mugo** (Diviner) - Likely a repetition of *Mũndũ mũgo* * **Kĩugo** (Word) - Repetition * **Kĩogo** (Head) - (Note: The common word for head is *kĩongo* or *mutwe*) * **Ĩgego** (Tooth) - Repetition * **Magego** (Teeth) - Plural of *Igego* * **Mbogo** (Buffalo) - Repetition * **Mitugo** (Behavior) - Plural
